contents.text: o Accept and process a message received from another role (see section 4.6.2). This includes:
contents.zh-CHS: o 接受并处理从其他角色收到的消息（见第4.6.2节）。这包括：

contents.text: - identifying if the message belongs to a transaction that has been received before
contents.zh-CHS: - 标识消息是否属于以前收到的事务

contents.text: - handling duplicate messages
contents.zh-CHS: - 处理重复消息

contents.text: - generating Transient errors if the servers that process the input message are too busy to handle it
contents.zh-CHS: - 如果处理输入消息的服务器太忙而无法处理该消息，则生成暂时性错误

contents.text: - processing the message if it is error free and, if appropriate, producing a response to send back to the other role
contents.zh-CHS: - 处理无错误的消息，并在适当的情况下生成响应以发送回其他角色

contents.text: o Cancel a current transaction if requested, for example by the User (see section 4.6.3)
contents.zh-CHS: o 如果用户提出请求，取消当前交易（参见第4.6.3节）

contents.text: o Re-transmit messages if a response was expected but has not been received in a reasonable time (see section 4.6.4).
contents.zh-CHS: o 如果预期有响应，但在合理时间内未收到响应，则重新发送消息（见第4.6.4节）。

contents.text: 4.6.1 Initiating Transactions
contents.zh-CHS: 4.6.1 启动交易

contents.text: The Consumer Role may initiate a number of different types of transaction. Specifically:
contents.zh-CHS: 消费者角色可以发起许多不同类型的交易。明确地：

contents.text: o an Inquiry Transaction (see section 9.2.1)
contents.zh-CHS: o 询价交易（见第9.2.1节）

contents.text: o a Ping Transaction (see section 9.2.2)
contents.zh-CHS: o Ping交易（见第9.2.2节）

contents.text: o an Authentication Transaction (see section 9.1.6)
contents.zh-CHS: o 认证事务（见第9.1.6节）

contents.text: 4.6.2 Processing Input Messages
contents.zh-CHS: 4.6.2 处理输入消息

contents.text: Processing of Input Messages for a Consumer Role is the same as for an IOTP Server (see section 4.5.2) except in the area of checking for Errors in Block Sequence (for an IOTP Server see section 4.5.2.4). This is described below
contents.zh-CHS: 消费者角色的输入消息处理与IOTP服务器（见第4.5.2节）相同，但检查块序列中的错误除外（IOTP服务器见第4.5.2.4节）。下文将对此进行说明

contents.text: Note: The description of the processing for an IOTP Server includes consideration of multi-threading of input messages and multi-tasking of requests. For the Consumer Role - particularly if running on a stand-alone system such as a PC - use of multi-threading is a decision of the implementer of the consumer role IOTP solution.
contents.zh-CHS: 注：IOTP服务器处理的描述包括考虑输入消息的多线程和请求的多任务。对于消费者角色，尤其是在单机系统（如PC）上运行时，多线程的使用由消费者角色IOTP解决方案的实施者决定。

contents.text: 4.6.2.1 Check for Errors in Block Sequence
contents.zh-CHS: 4.6.2.1 检查块序列中的错误

contents.text: The handling of the following blocks is the same as for an IOTP Server (see section 4.5.2.4) except that the Consumer Role is substituted for IOTP Server Role:
contents.zh-CHS: 以下模块的处理与IOTP服务器相同（见第4.5.2.4节），但消费者角色替代了IOTP服务器角色：

contents.text: o Error and Cancel Blocks,
contents.zh-CHS: o 错误和取消块，

contents.text: o Inquiry Request and Response Blocks,
contents.zh-CHS: o 查询请求和响应块，

contents.text: o Authentication Request, Response and Status Blocks.
contents.zh-CHS: o 身份验证请求、响应和状态块。

contents.text: For the other blocks a Consumer role might receive, the potential errors in the sequence that blocks arrive depends on the block. Blocks where checking for sequence is required are:
contents.zh-CHS: 对于使用者角色可能接收的其他块，块到达顺序中的潜在错误取决于该块。需要检查序列的块包括：

contents.text: o TPO Block. Check as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: o TPO块。检查如下：

contents.text: - if the input message also contains an Authentication Request block and an Offer Response Block then there is a Hard Error, otherwise
contents.zh-CHS: - 如果输入消息还包含身份验证请求块和提供响应块，则存在硬错误，否则

contents.text: - if the input message also contains an Authentication Request block and Authentication Status block then there is Hard Error otherwise,
contents.zh-CHS: - 如果输入消息还包含身份验证请求块和身份验证状态块，则存在硬错误，否则，

contents.text: - if the input message also contains an Authentication Request block and the IOTP Transaction is recognised by the Consumer role's system, then there is a Hard Error, otherwise
contents.zh-CHS: - 如果输入消息还包含身份验证请求块，并且IOTP事务被消费者角色的系统识别，则存在硬错误，否则

contents.text: - if the input message also contains an Authentication Status block and the IOTP Transaction is not recognised by the Consumer role's system then there is a Hard Error, otherwise
contents.zh-CHS: - 如果输入消息还包含身份验证状态块，且消费者角色的系统无法识别IOTP事务，则存在硬错误，否则

contents.text: - if input message also contains an Authentication Status Block and the Authentication Status Block has not been sent after an earlier Authentication Response message then there is a hard error
contents.zh-CHS: - 如果输入消息还包含身份验证状态块，并且身份验证状态块未在先前的身份验证响应消息之后发送，则存在硬错误

contents.text: - if input message also contains an Offer Response Block and the IOTP Transaction is recognised by the Consumer role's system then there is a Hard Error, otherwise
contents.zh-CHS: - 如果输入消息还包含报价响应块，且消费者角色的系统识别IOTP交易，则存在硬错误，否则

contents.text: - if the TPO Block occurs on its own and the IOTP Transaction is recognised by the Consumer role's system then there is a Hard Error
contents.zh-CHS: - 如果TPO阻塞自行发生，且IOTP事务被消费者角色的系统识别，则存在硬错误

contents.text: o Offer Response Block. Check as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: o 提供响应块。检查如下：

contents.text: - if the Offer Response Block is part of a Brand Independent Offer Exchange (see section 9.1.2.2) then there is no sequence checking as it is part of the first message received, otherwise
contents.zh-CHS: - 如果要约响应块是品牌独立要约交换的一部分（见第9.1.2.2节），则不进行序列检查，因为它是收到的第一条消息的一部分，否则

contents.text: - if the Offer Response Block is not part of an IOTP Transaction that is recognised by the Consumer role then there is a Hard Error, otherwise
contents.zh-CHS: - 如果报价响应块不是消费者角色识别的IOTP交易的一部分，则存在硬错误，否则

contents.text: - if the Offer Response Block does not refer to an IOTP transaction where a TPO Selection Block was the last message sent then there is a Hard Error
contents.zh-CHS: - 如果要约响应块未引用上次发送TPO选择块的IOTP事务，则存在硬错误

contents.text: o Payment Exchange Block. Check as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: o 支付交换区。检查如下：

contents.text: - if the Payment Exchange Block doesn't refer to an IOTP Transaction that is recognised by the Consumer role's system then there is a Hard Error, otherwise
contents.zh-CHS: - 如果支付交换块未引用消费者角色系统识别的IOTP交易，则存在硬错误，否则

contents.text: - if the Payment Exchange doesn't refer to an IOTP Transaction where either a Payment Request or a Payment Exchange block was most recently sent then there is a Hard Error
contents.zh-CHS: - 如果支付交换不涉及最近发送了支付请求或支付交换块的IOTP交易，则存在硬错误

contents.text: o Payment Response Block. Check as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: o 支付响应块。检查如下：

contents.text: - if the Payment Response Block doesn't refer to an IOTP Transaction that is recognised by the Consumer role's system then there is a Hard Error, otherwise
contents.zh-CHS: - 如果支付响应块未引用消费者角色系统识别的IOTP交易，则存在硬错误，否则

contents.text: - if the Payment Response doesn't refer to an IOTOP Transaction where either a Payment Request or a Payment Exchange block was most recently sent then there is a Hard Error
contents.zh-CHS: - 如果付款响应不涉及最近发送付款请求或付款交换块的IOTOP交易，则存在硬错误

contents.text: o Delivery Response Block. Check as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: o 传递响应块。检查如下：

contents.text: - if the Delivery Response Block doesn't refer to an IOTP Transaction that is recognised by the Consumer role's system then there is a Hard Error, otherwise
contents.zh-CHS: - 如果交付响应块未引用消费者角色系统识别的IOTP交易，则存在硬错误，否则

contents.text: - If the Delivery Response doesn't refer to an IOTP Transaction where either a Payment Request or a Payment Exchange block was most recently sent then there is a Hard Error
contents.zh-CHS: - 如果交付响应不涉及最近发送了付款请求或付款交换块的IOTP交易，则存在硬错误

contents.text: 4.6.3 Cancelling a Transaction
contents.zh-CHS: 4.6.3 取消交易

contents.text: This process cancels a current transaction on an Consumer role's system as a result of an external request from the user, or another system or server in the Consumer's role. The processing is the same as for an IOTP Server (see section 4.5.3).
contents.zh-CHS: 由于用户或消费者角色的另一个系统或服务器发出外部请求，此过程取消消费者角色系统上的当前事务。处理过程与IOTP服务器相同（见第4.5.3节）。

contents.text: 4.6.4 Retransmitting Messages
contents.zh-CHS: 4.6.4 重发消息

contents.text: The process of retransmitting messages is the same as for an IOTP Server (see section 4.5.4).
contents.zh-CHS: 重传消息的过程与IOTP服务器相同（见第4.5.4节）。

contents.text: 5. Security Considerations
contents.zh-CHS: 5. 安全考虑

contents.text: This section considers, from an IETF perspective how IOTP addresses security. The next section (see section 6. Digital Signatures and IOTP) describes how IOTP uses Digital Signatures when these are needed.
contents.zh-CHS: 本节从IETF的角度考虑IOTP如何解决安全问题。下一节（见第6节数字签名和IOTP）描述了IOTP在需要时如何使用数字签名。

contents.text: This section covers:
contents.zh-CHS: 本节包括：

contents.text: o determining whether to use digital signatures
contents.zh-CHS: o 确定是否使用数字签名

contents.text: o data privacy, and
contents.zh-CHS: o 数据隐私，以及

contents.text: o payment protocol security.
contents.zh-CHS: o 支付协议安全。

contents.text: 5.1 Determining whether to use digital signatures
contents.zh-CHS: 5.1 确定是否使用数字签名

contents.text: The use of digital signatures within IOTP are entirely optional. IOTP can work successfully entirely without the use of digital signatures.
contents.zh-CHS: 在IOTP中使用数字签名完全是可选的。IOTP完全可以在不使用数字签名的情况下成功运行。

contents.text: Ultimately it is up to the Merchant, or other trading role, to decide whether IOTP Messages will include signatures, and for the Consumer
contents.zh-CHS: 最终，由商户或其他交易角色决定IOTP消息是否包含签名，并为消费者提供签名

contents.text: to decide whether carrying out a transaction without signatures is an acceptable risk. If Merchants discover that transactions without signatures are not being accepted, then they will either:
contents.zh-CHS: 决定在没有签名的情况下进行交易是否是可接受的风险。如果商户发现没有签名的交易不被接受，他们将：

contents.text: o start using signatures,
contents.zh-CHS: o 开始使用签名，

contents.text: o find a method of working which does not need signatures, or
contents.zh-CHS: o 找到一种不需要签名的工作方法，或

contents.text: o accept a lower volume and value of business.
contents.zh-CHS: o 接受较低的业务量和价值。

contents.text: A non-exhaustive list of the reasons why digital signatures might be used follows:
contents.zh-CHS: 可能使用数字签名的原因的非详尽列表如下：

contents.text: o the Merchant (or other trading role) wants to demonstrate that they can be trusted. If, for example, a merchant generates an Offer Response Signature (see section 7.19.2) using a certificate from a trusted third party, known to the Consumer, then the Consumer can check the signature and certificate and so more reasonably rely on the offer being from the actual Organisation the Merchant claims to be. In this case signatures using asymmetric cryptography are likely to be required
contents.zh-CHS: o 商户（或其他交易角色）希望证明他们是可信的。例如，如果商户使用消费者已知的可信第三方的证书生成要约响应签名（见第7.19.2节），则消费者可以检查签名和证书，从而更合理地依赖来自商户声称的实际组织的要约。在这种情况下，可能需要使用非对称加密的签名

contents.text: o the Merchant, or other Trading Role, want to generate a record of the transaction that is fit for a particular purpose. For example, with appropriate trust hierarchies, digital signatures could be checked by the Consumer to determine:
contents.zh-CHS: o 商户或其他交易角色希望生成适合特定用途的交易记录。例如，通过适当的信任层次结构，消费者可以检查数字签名以确定：

contents.text: - if it would be accepted by tax authorities as a valid record of a transaction, or
contents.zh-CHS: - 如果税务机关将其视为交易的有效记录，或

contents.text: - if some warranty, for example from a "Better Business Bureau" orsimilar was being provided
contents.zh-CHS: - 如果提供了一些担保，例如“更好的商业局”或类似的担保

contents.text: o the Payment Handler, or Delivery Handler, needs to know that the request is unaltered and authorised. For example, in IOTP, details of how much to pay is sent to the Consumer in the Offer Response and then forwarded to the Payment Handler in a Payment Request. If the request is not signed, the Consumer could change the amount due by, for example, removing a digit. If the Payment Handler has no access to the original payment information in the Offer Response, then, without signatures, the Payment Handler cannot be sure that the data has not been altered. Similarly, if the payment information is not digitally signed, the Payment Handler cannot be sure who is the Merchant that is requesting the payment
contents.zh-CHS: o 支付处理人或交付处理人需要知道请求未经更改和授权。例如，在IOTP中，支付金额的详细信息在报价响应中发送给消费者，然后在支付请求中转发给支付处理程序。如果请求没有签名，消费者可以更改到期金额，例如删除一个数字。如果支付处理程序无法访问报价响应中的原始支付信息，则在没有签名的情况下，支付处理程序无法确保数据未被更改。类似地，如果支付信息没有数字签名，则支付处理程序无法确定谁是请求支付的商户

contents.text: o a Payment Handler or Delivery Handler wants to provide a non-refutable record of the completion status of a Payment or Delivery. If a Payment Response or Delivery Response is signed,
contents.zh-CHS: o 付款处理人或交付处理人希望提供付款或交付完成状态的不可反驳记录。如果签署了付款回复或交货回复，

contents.text: then the Consumer can later use the record of the Payment or Delivery to prove that it occurred. This could be used, for example, for customer care purposes.
contents.zh-CHS: 然后，消费者可以稍后使用付款或交货记录来证明其发生。例如，这可以用于客户关怀目的。

contents.text: A non-exhaustive list of the reasons why digital signatures might not be used follows:
contents.zh-CHS: 可能不使用数字签名的原因如下：

contents.text: o trading roles are combined therefore changes to data made by the consumer can be detected. One of the reasons for using signatures is so that one trading role can determine if data has been changed by the Consumer or some other party. However if the trading roles have access to the necessary data, then it might be possible to compare, for example, the payment information in the Payment Request with the payment information in the Offer Response. Access to the data necessary could be realised by, for example, the Merchant and Payment Handler roles being carried out by the same Organisation on the same system, or the Merchant and Payment Handler roles being carried out on different systems but the systems can communicate in some way. (Note this type of communication is outside the current scope of IOTP)
contents.zh-CHS: o 合并交易角色，因此可以检测消费者对数据所做的更改。使用签名的原因之一是，一个交易角色可以确定消费者或其他方是否更改了数据。但是，如果交易角色可以访问必要的数据，则可以比较（例如）付款请求中的付款信息与报价响应中的付款信息。例如，可通过同一组织在同一系统上执行的商户和支付处理人角色，或在不同系统上执行的商户和支付处理人角色实现对必要数据的访问，但系统可以通过某种方式进行通信。（注：此类通信不在IOTP的当前范围内）

contents.text: o the processing cost of the cryptography is too high. For example, if a payment is being made of only a few cents, the cost of carrying out all the cryptography associated with generating and checking digital signatures might make the whole transaction uneconomic. Co-locating trading roles, could help avoid this problem.
contents.zh-CHS: o 加密的处理成本太高。例如，如果只支付几美分，那么执行与生成和检查数字签名相关的所有加密的成本可能会使整个交易变得不经济。共同定位交易角色有助于避免这一问题。

contents.text: 5.2 Symmetric and Asymmetric Cryptography
contents.zh-CHS: 5.2 对称和非对称密码

contents.text: The advantage of using symmetric keys with IOTP is that no Public Key Infrastructure need be set up and just the Merchant, Payment Handler and Delivery Handler need to agree on the shared secrets to use.
contents.zh-CHS: 在IOTP中使用对称密钥的优点是不需要设置公钥基础设施，只有商户、支付处理方和交付处理方需要就使用的共享秘密达成一致。

contents.text: However the disadvantage of symmetric cryptography is that the Consumer cannot easily check the credentials of the Merchant, Payment Handler, etc. that they are dealing with. This is likely to reduce, somewhat, the trust that the Consumer will have carrying out the transaction.
contents.zh-CHS: 然而，对称加密的缺点是消费者无法轻松检查他们正在处理的商户、支付处理人等的凭证。这可能会在一定程度上降低消费者对交易的信任。

contents.text: However it should be noted that even if asymmetric cryptography is being used, the Consumer does not NEED to be provided with any digital certificates as the integrity of the transaction is determined by, for example, the Payment Handler checking the Offer Response Signature copied to the Payment Request.
contents.zh-CHS: 然而，应当注意的是，即使正在使用非对称加密，也不需要向消费者提供任何数字证书，因为交易的完整性是由例如支付处理程序检查复制到支付请求的要约响应签名来确定的。

contents.text: Note that symmetric, asymmetric or both types of cryptography may be used in a single transaction.
contents.zh-CHS: 请注意，在单个事务中可以使用对称、非对称或两种类型的加密。

contents.text: 5.3 Data Privacy
contents.zh-CHS: 5.3 数据隐私

contents.text: Privacy of information is provided by sending IOTP Messages between the various Trading Roles using a secure channel such as [SSL/TLS]. Use of a secure channel within IOTP is optional.
contents.zh-CHS: 通过使用安全通道（如[SSL/TLS]）在各种交易角色之间发送IOTP消息来提供信息隐私。在IOTP内使用安全通道是可选的。

contents.text: 5.4 Payment Protocol Security
contents.zh-CHS: 5.4 支付协议安全

contents.text: IOTP is designed to be completely blind to the payment protocol being used to effect a payment. From the security perspective, this means that IOTP neither helps, nor hinders, the achievement of payment security.
contents.zh-CHS: IOTP被设计为完全无视用于实现支付的支付协议。从安全角度来看，这意味着IOTP既不帮助也不妨碍支付安全的实现。

contents.text: If it is necessary to consider payment security from an IOTP perspective, then this should be included in the payment protocol supplement which describes how IOTP supports that payment protocol.
contents.zh-CHS: 如果有必要从IOTP角度考虑支付安全性，那么这应该包含在支付协议补充中，它描述了IOTP如何支持该支付协议。

contents.text: However what IOTP is designed to do is to use digital signatures to bind together the record, contained in a "response" message, of each trading exchange in a transaction. For example IOTP can bind together: an Offer, a Payment and a Delivery.
contents.zh-CHS: 然而，IOTP的设计目的是使用数字签名将交易中每个交易交易所的“响应”消息中包含的记录绑定在一起。例如，IOTP可以绑定在一起：要约、付款和交付。

contents.text: 6. Digital Signatures and IOTP
contents.zh-CHS: 6. 数字签名与物联网

contents.text: IOTP can work successfully without using any digital signatures although in an open networking environment it will be less secure - see 5. Security Considerations for a description of the factors that need to be considered.
contents.zh-CHS: IOTP可以在不使用任何数字签名的情况下成功工作，尽管在开放网络环境中，它的安全性较低-见5。需要考虑的因素描述的安全注意事项。

contents.text: However, this section describes how to use digital signatures in the many situations when they will be needed. Topics covered are:
contents.zh-CHS: 但是，本节介绍了在许多需要数字签名的情况下如何使用数字签名。主题包括：

contents.text: o an overview of how IOTP uses digital signatures
contents.zh-CHS: o IOTP如何使用数字签名概述

contents.text: o how to check a signature is correctly calculated
contents.zh-CHS: o 如何检查签名是否正确计算

contents.text: o how Payment Handlers and Delivery Handlers check they can carry out payments or deliveries on behalf of a Merchant.
contents.zh-CHS: o 支付处理人员和交付处理人员如何检查他们是否可以代表商户进行支付或交付。

contents.text: 6.1 How IOTP uses Digital Signatures
contents.zh-CHS: 6.1 IOTP如何使用数字签名

contents.text: In general, signatures when used with IOTP:
contents.zh-CHS: 通常，当与IOTP一起使用时，签名：

contents.text: o are always treated as IOTP Components (see section 7)
contents.zh-CHS: o 始终被视为IOTP组件（见第7节）

contents.text: o contain digests of one or more IOTP Components or Trading Blocks, possibly including other Signature Components, in any IOTP message within the same IOTP Transaction
contents.zh-CHS: o 在同一IOTP交易中的任何IOTP消息中包含一个或多个IOTP组件或交易块的摘要，可能包括其他签名组件

contents.text: o identify:
contents.zh-CHS: o 确定：

contents.text: - which Organisation signed (originated) the signature, and
contents.zh-CHS: - 哪个组织签署（发起）该签名，以及

contents.text: - which Organisation(s) should process the signature in order to check that the Action the Organisation should take can occur.
contents.zh-CHS: - 哪些组织应处理签名，以检查组织应采取的行动是否可能发生。

contents.text: Digital certificates may be associated with digital signatures if asymmetric cryptography is being used. However if symmetric cryptography is being used, then the digital certificate will be replaced by some identifier of the secret key to use.
contents.zh-CHS: 如果使用非对称加密，则数字证书可能与数字签名相关联。但是，如果使用对称加密，则数字证书将替换为要使用的密钥的某个标识符。

contents.text: The way in which Signatures Components digest one or more elements is illustrated in the figure below.
contents.zh-CHS: 签名组件消化一个或多个元素的方式如下图所示。

contents.text: IOTP MESSAGE SIGNATURE COMPONENT
contents.zh-CHS: IOTP消息签名组件

contents.text:

 |-Trans Ref Block        digest TransRefBlk   |-Manifest
 |  |      ID=P1.1-----------------------------|->|-Digest of P1.1--
 |  |-Trans Id Comp       digest TransIdComp   |  |                 |
 |  |     ID = M1.2----------------------------|->|-Digest of M1.2--|
 |  |-Msg Id Comp.           digest Signature  |  |                 |
 |  |      ID = P1          -------------------|->|-Digest of M1.5--|
 |                         |   digest element  |  |                 |
 |-Signatures Block        |  -----------------|->|-Digest of M1.7--|
 |  |       ID=P1.2        | |  digest element |  |                 |
 |  |-Signature ID=P1.3    | |  ---------------|->|-Digest of C1.4--|
 |  |-Signature ID=M1.5----  | |               |  |                 |

       within the same IOTP Transaction
*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*
Figure 10 Signature Digests
contents.zh-CHS: 图10签名摘要

contents.text: Note: The classic example of one signature signing another in IOTP, is when an Offer is first signed by a Merchant creating an "Offer Response" signature, which is then later signed by a Payment Handler together with a record of the payment creating a "Payment Receipt" signature. In this way, the payment in an IOTP Transaction is bound to the Merchant's offer.
contents.zh-CHS: 注：IOTP中一个签名与另一个签名的经典示例是，商户首先签署要约，创建“要约-响应”签名，然后由支付处理程序与付款记录一起签名，创建“付款收据”签名。通过这种方式，IOTP交易中的付款与商户的报价绑定。

contents.text: Note that one Manifest may be associated with multiple signature "Value" elements where each Value element contains a digital signature over the same Manifest, perhaps using the same (or different) signature algorithm but using a different certificate or shared secret key. Specifically it will allow the Merchant to agree on different shared secrets keys with their Payment Handler and Delivery Handler.
contents.zh-CHS: 请注意，一个清单可能与多个签名“值”元素关联，其中每个值元素包含同一清单上的数字签名，可能使用相同（或不同）的签名算法，但使用不同的证书或共享密钥。具体而言，它将允许商户与其支付处理程序和交付处理程序就不同的共享密钥达成一致。

contents.text: The detailed definitions of a Signature component are contained in section 7.19.
contents.zh-CHS: 签名组件的详细定义见第7.19节。

contents.text: The remainder of this section contains:
contents.zh-CHS: 本节剩余部分包括：

contents.text: o an example of how IOTP uses signatures
contents.zh-CHS: o IOTP如何使用签名的示例

contents.text: o how the OriginatorInfo and RecipientInfo elements within a Signature Component are used to identify the Organisations associated with the signature
contents.zh-CHS: o 如何使用签名组件中的OriginatorInfo和RecipientInfo元素来标识与签名关联的组织

contents.text: o how IOTP uses signatures to prove actions complete successfully
contents.zh-CHS: o IOTP如何使用签名证明操作成功完成

contents.text: 6.1.1 IOTP Signature Example
contents.zh-CHS: 6.1.1 IOTP签名示例

contents.text: An example of how signatures are used is illustrated in the figure below which shows how the various components and elements in a Baseline Purchase relate to one another. Refer to this example in the later description of how signatures are used to check a payment or delivery can occur (see section 6.3).
contents.zh-CHS: 下图举例说明了如何使用签名，该图显示了基线购买中的各种组件和元素如何相互关联。在后面关于如何使用签名检查付款或交付的描述中，请参考此示例（参见第6.3节）。

contents.text: Note: A Baseline Purchase transaction has been used for illustration purposes. The usage of the elements and attributes is the same for all types of IOTP Transactions.
contents.zh-CHS: 注：基线采购交易记录已用于说明目的。元素和属性的使用对于所有类型的IOTP事务都是相同的。

contents.text:

      |                       |              |           -Manifest

      |  Ref                     Element     | Originator |-Orig.
      v                         (Merchant)    ------------|--Info
    Brand List                                    Ref     |

 | | Amount Elem   |         Component <------------------|--Info
 | |   |           |          |                 Refs      |

 | |   | Ref       |OrgRef       Element                  |
 | |   v           |          (Payment Handler)           |
 |  -PayProtocol--                                        |
 |    Elem                  ->Organisation    Recipient   |-Recipient
 |                         |  Component <--------------------Info
 |                         |  |                 Refs
 |                         |   -Trading Role
 |                         |     Element
 |                         | (Delivery Handler
 |
 |           OFFER RESPONSE BLOCK

   Component                  Component

The Manifest element in the Signature Component contains digests of: the Trans Ref Block (not shown); the Transaction ID Component (not shown); Organisation Components (Merchant, Payment Handler, Delivery Handler); the Brand List Component; the Order Component, the Payment Component the Delivery Component and the Brand Selection Component (if a Brand Dependent Purchase).
contents.zh-CHS: 签名组件中的Manifest元素包含以下内容的摘要：Trans-Ref块（未显示）；事务ID组件（未显示）；组织组成部分（商户、支付处理人、交付处理人）；品牌列表组件；订单组件、付款组件、交付组件和品牌选择组件（如果是品牌相关购买）。

contents.text: Figure 11 Example use of Signatures for Baseline Purchase
contents.zh-CHS: 图11基线购买的签名使用示例

contents.text: 6.1.2 OriginatorInfo and RecipientInfo Elements
contents.zh-CHS: 6.1.2 OriginatorInfo和RecipientInfo元素

contents.text: The OriginatorRef attribute of the OriginatorInfo element in the Signature Component contains an Element Reference (see section 3.5) that points to the Organisation Component of the Organisation which generated the Signature. In this example its the Merchant.
contents.zh-CHS: 签名组件中OriginatorInfo元素的OriginatorRef属性包含一个元素引用（见第3.5节），该元素引用指向生成签名的组织的组织组件。在这个例子中，它是商人。

contents.text: Note that the value of the content of the Attribute element with a Type attribute set to IOTP Signature Type must match the Trading Role of the Organisation which signed it. If it does not, then it is an error. Valid combinations are given in the table below.
contents.zh-CHS: 请注意，类型属性设置为IOTP签名类型的属性元素的内容值必须与签署该属性的组织的交易角色匹配。如果没有，那就是一个错误。下表给出了有效的组合。

contents.text: IOTP Signature Type Valid Trading Role
contents.zh-CHS: IOTP签名类型有效交易角色

contents.text: OfferResponse Merchant
contents.zh-CHS: 报价响应商

contents.text: PaymentResponse PaymentHandler
contents.zh-CHS: PaymentResponse PaymentHandler

contents.text: DeliveryResponse DeliveryHandler
contents.zh-CHS: DeliveryResponse DeliveryHandler

contents.text: AuthenticationRequest any role
contents.zh-CHS: 身份验证请求任何角色

contents.text: AuthenticationResponse any role
contents.zh-CHS: AuthenticationResponse任意角色

contents.text: PingRequest any role
contents.zh-CHS: 请求任何角色

contents.text: PingResponse any role
contents.zh-CHS: PingResponse任何角色

contents.text: The RecipientRefs attribute of the RecipientInfo element in the Signature Component contains Element References to the Organisation Components of the Organisations that should use the signature to verify that:
contents.zh-CHS: 签名组件中RecipientInfo元素的RecipientRefs属性包含对应使用签名验证以下内容的组织的组织组件的元素引用：

contents.text: o they have a pre-existing relationship with the Organisation that generated the signature,
contents.zh-CHS: o 他们与生成签名的组织有着预先存在的关系，

contents.text: o the data which is secured by the signature has not been changed,
contents.zh-CHS: o 由签名保护的数据未被更改，

contents.text: o the data has been signed correctly, and
contents.zh-CHS: o 数据已正确签名，并且

contents.text: o the action they are required to undertake on behalf of the Merchant is therefore authorised.
contents.zh-CHS: o 因此，授权他们代表商户采取行动。

contents.text: Note that if symmetric cryptography is being used then a separate RecipientInfo and Value elements for each different set of shared secret keys are likely within the Signature Component.
contents.zh-CHS: 请注意，如果使用对称加密，那么签名组件中可能会有一个单独的RecipientInfo和值元素，用于每个不同的共享密钥集。

contents.text: Alternatively if asymmetric cryptography is being used then the RecpientRefs attribute of one RecipientInfo element may refer to multiple Organisation Components if they are all using the same certificates.
contents.zh-CHS: 或者，如果使用非对称加密，则一个RecipientInfo元素的RecpientRefs属性可能引用多个组织组件（如果它们都使用相同的证书）。

contents.text: 6.1.3 Using signatures to Prove Actions Complete Successfully
contents.zh-CHS: 6.1.3 使用签名证明操作已成功完成

contents.text: Proving an action completed successfully, is achieved by signing data on Response messages. Specifically:
contents.zh-CHS: 通过在响应消息上签名数据来证明操作已成功完成。明确地：

contents.text: o on the Offer Response, when a Merchant is making an Offer to the Consumer which can then be sent to either:
contents.zh-CHS: o 在报价响应中，当商户向消费者发出报价时，该报价可发送至：

contents.text: - a Payment Handler to prove that the Merchant authorises Payment, or
contents.zh-CHS: - 支付处理人证明商户授权支付，或

contents.text: - a Delivery Handler to prove that Merchant authorises Delivery, provided other necessary authorisations are complete (see below)
contents.zh-CHS: - 交付处理人证明商户授权交付，前提是其他必要授权已完成（见下文）

contents.text: o on the Payment Response, when a Payment Handler is generating a Payment Receipt which can be sent to either:
contents.zh-CHS: o 在付款响应中，当付款处理程序生成付款收据时，该收据可发送至：

contents.text: - a Delivery Handler, in a Delivery Request Block to authorise Delivery together with the Offer Response signature, or
contents.zh-CHS: - 交付处理人，在交付请求块中授权交付以及报价响应签名，或

contents.text: - another Payment Handler, in a second Payment Request, to authorise the second payment in a Value Exchange IOTP Transaction
contents.zh-CHS: - 另一个支付处理程序在第二个支付请求中授权价值交换IOTP交易中的第二次支付

contents.text: o Delivery Response, when a Delivery Handler is generating a Delivery Note. This can be used to prove after the event what the Delivery Handler said they would do
contents.zh-CHS: o 交付响应，当交付处理程序生成交付通知时。这可以用来证明事件发生后交付处理程序说他们会做什么

contents.text: o Authentication Response. One method of authenticating another party to a trade is to send an Authentication Request specifying that a Digital Signature should be used for authentication
contents.zh-CHS: o 身份验证响应。对交易的另一方进行身份验证的一种方法是发送身份验证请求，指定应使用数字签名进行身份验证

contents.text: o Transaction Status Inquiry. The Inquiry Response Block may be digitally signed to attest to the authenticity of the response
contents.zh-CHS: o 交易状态查询。可以对查询响应块进行数字签名以证明响应的真实性

contents.text: o Ping. The Ping Response may be digitally signed so that checks can be made that the signature can be understood.
contents.zh-CHS: o 发出砰的声响。可以对Ping响应进行数字签名，以便可以进行检查以确保签名能够被理解。

contents.text: This proof of an action may, in future versions of IOTP, also be used to prove after the event that the IOTP transaction occurred. For example to a Customer Care Provider.
contents.zh-CHS: 在IOTP的未来版本中，该行动证明也可用于在事件发生后证明IOTP交易。例如，客户服务提供商。

contents.text: 6.2 Checking a Signature is Correctly Calculated
contents.zh-CHS: 6.2 检查签名是否正确计算

contents.text: Checking a signature is correctly calculated is part of checking for Message Level Errors (see section 4.3.2). It is included here so that all signature and security related considerations are kept together.
contents.zh-CHS: 检查签名是否正确计算是检查消息级错误的一部分（见第4.3.2节）。这里包含了它，以便将所有签名和安全相关的注意事项放在一起。

contents.text: Before a Trading Role can check a signature it must identify which of the potentially multiple Signature elements should be checked. The steps involved are as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: 在交易角色可以检查签名之前，它必须确定应该检查哪些潜在的多个签名元素。所涉及的步骤如下：

contents.text: o check that a Signature Block is present and it contains one or more Signature Components
contents.zh-CHS: o 检查签名块是否存在，它是否包含一个或多个签名组件

contents.text: o identify the Organisation Component which contains an OrgId attribute for the Organisation which is carrying out the signature check. If no or more than one Organisation Component is found then it is an error
contents.zh-CHS: o 识别包含执行签名检查的组织的OrgId属性的组织组件。如果未发现或发现多个组织组成部分，则为错误

contents.text: o use the ID attribute of the Organisation Component to find the RecipientInfo element that contains a RecipientRefs attribute that refers to that Organisation Component. Note there may be no signatures to verify
contents.zh-CHS: o 使用组织组件的ID属性查找RecipientInfo元素，该元素包含引用该组织组件的RecipientRefs属性。注：可能没有要验证的签名

contents.text: o check the Signature Component that contains the identified RecipientInfo element as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: o 检查包含已标识RecipientInfo元素的签名组件，如下所示：

contents.text: - use the SignatureValueRef and the SignatureAlgorithmRef attributes to identify, respectively: the Value element that contains the signature to be checked and the Signature Algorithm element that describes the signature algorithm to be used to verify the Signature, then
contents.zh-CHS: - 使用SignatureValueRef和SignatureAlgorithmRef属性分别标识：包含要检查的签名的Value元素和描述用于验证签名的签名算法的signature Algorithm元素，然后

contents.text: - if the Signature Algorithm element indicates that asymmetric cryptography is being used then use the SignatureCertRef to identify the Certificate to be used by the signature algorithm
contents.zh-CHS: - 如果Signature Algorithm元素指示正在使用非对称加密，则使用SignatureCertRef标识签名算法要使用的证书

contents.text: - if Signature Algorithm element indicates that symmetric cryptography is being used then the content of the RecipientInfo element is used to identify the correct shared secret key to use
contents.zh-CHS: - 如果Signature Algorithm元素指示正在使用对称加密，那么RecipientInfo元素的内容将用于标识要使用的正确共享密钥

contents.text: - use the specified signature algorithm to check that the Value Element correctly signs the Manifest Element
contents.zh-CHS: - 使用指定的签名算法检查Value元素是否正确地对Manifest元素签名

contents.text: - check that the Digest Elements in the Manifest Element are correctly calculated where Components or Blocks referenced by the Digest have been received by the Organisation checking the signature.
contents.zh-CHS: - 检查清单元素中的摘要元素是否正确计算，检查签名的组织是否已收到摘要引用的组件或块。

contents.text: 6.3 Checking a Payment or Delivery can occur
contents.zh-CHS: 6.3 检查付款或交付可能发生

contents.text: This section describes the processes required for a Payment Handler or Delivery Handler to check that a payment or delivery can occur. This may include checking signatures if this is specified by the Merchant.
contents.zh-CHS: 本节描述支付处理程序或交付处理程序检查是否可以进行支付或交付所需的流程。这可能包括检查商户指定的签名。

contents.text: In outline the steps are:
contents.zh-CHS: 在大纲中，这些步骤是：

contents.text: o check that the Payment Request or Delivery Request has been sent to the correct Organisation
contents.zh-CHS: o 检查付款请求或交货请求是否已发送至正确的组织

contents.text: o check that correct IOTP components are present in the request, and
contents.zh-CHS: o 检查请求中是否存在正确的IOTP组件，以及

contents.text: o check that the payment or delivery is authorised
contents.zh-CHS: o 检查付款或交付是否得到授权

contents.text: For clarity and brevity the following terms or phrases are used in this section:
contents.zh-CHS: 为清晰和简洁起见，本节使用了以下术语或短语：

contents.text: o a "Request Block" is used to refer to either a Payment Request Block (see section 8.7) or a Delivery Request Block (see section 8.10) unless specified to the contrary
contents.zh-CHS: o “请求块”用于指付款请求块（见第8.7节）或交付请求块（见第8.10节），除非另有规定

contents.text: o a "Response Block" is used to refer to either a Payment Response Block (see section 8.9) or a Delivery Response Block (see section 8.11)
contents.zh-CHS: o “响应块”用于指支付响应块（见第8.9节）或交付响应块（见第8.11节）

contents.text: o an "Action" is used to refer to an action which occurs on receipt of a Request Block. Actions can be either a Payment or a Delivery
contents.zh-CHS: o “操作”用于指在收到请求块时发生的操作。操作可以是付款或交付

contents.text: o an "Action Organisation", is used to refer to the Payment Handler or Delivery Handler that carries out an Action
contents.zh-CHS: o “行动组织”是指执行行动的付款处理人或交付处理人

contents.text: o a "Signer of an Action", is used to refer to the Organisations that sign data about an Action to authorise the Action, either in whole or in part
contents.zh-CHS: o “行动签署人”是指签署行动数据以授权全部或部分行动的组织

contents.text: o a "Verifier of an Action", is used to refer to the Organisations that verify data to determine if they are authorised to carry out the Action
contents.zh-CHS: o “行动验证人”是指验证数据以确定其是否有权执行行动的组织

contents.text: o an ActionOrgRef attribute contains Element References which can be used to identify the "Action Organisation" that should carry out an Action
contents.zh-CHS: o ActionOrgRef属性包含元素引用，可用于标识应执行操作的“操作组织”

contents.text: 6.3.1 Check Request Block sent Correct Organisation
contents.zh-CHS: 6.3.1 检查请求块发送的组织是否正确

contents.text: Checking the Request Block was sent to the correct Organisation varies depending on whether the request refers to a Payment or a Delivery.
contents.zh-CHS: 检查请求块是否发送到正确的组织取决于请求是指付款还是交付。

contents.text: 6.3.1.1 Payment

In outline a Payment Handler checks if it can accept or make a payment by identifying the Payment Component in the Payment Request Block it has received, then using the ID of the Payment Component to track through the Brand List and Brand Selection Components to identify the Organisation selected by the Consumer and then checking that this Organisation is itself.
contents.zh-CHS: 在大纲中，付款处理程序通过在其收到的付款请求块中标识付款组件来检查其是否可以接受或进行付款，然后使用支付组件的ID跟踪品牌列表和品牌选择组件，以识别消费者选择的组织，然后检查该组织本身。

contents.text: The way data is accessed to do this is illustrated in the figure below.
contents.zh-CHS: 访问数据的方式如下图所示。

contents.text:
*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*
                                                  Start
                                                   |
                                                   v
Brand List<--------------------------+-----------Payment
Component         BrandListRef       |          Component
 |                                   |
 |-Brand<--------------------------  |
 | Element        BrandRef         | |
 |  |                          Brand Selection
 |  |Protocol                     Component
 |  | AmountRefs                   | |
 |  v                  Protocol    | |
 |-Protocol Amount<----------------  |
 | Element----------  AmountRef      |
 |  |               |                |
 |  |Currency       |Pay             |
 |  | AmountRefs    |Protocol        |
 |  v               |Ref             |
 |-Currency Amount  |                |
 | Element<---------|----------------
 |                  |
  -PayProtocol<-----
   Element---------------------->Organisation
                  Action         Component
                  OrgRef          |
                                   -Trading Role
                                     Element
                                  (Payment Handler)
Figure 12 Checking a Payment Handler can carry out a Payment
contents.zh-CHS: 图12检查支付处理程序是否可以执行支付

contents.text: The following describes the steps involved and the checks which need to be made:
contents.zh-CHS: 以下描述了所涉及的步骤和需要进行的检查：

contents.text: o Identify the Payment Component (see section 7.9) in the Payment Request Block that was received.
contents.zh-CHS: o 在收到的付款请求块中标识付款组件（见第7.9节）。

contents.text: o Identify the Brand List and Brand Selection Components for the Payment Component. This involves:
contents.zh-CHS: o 确定支付组件的品牌列表和品牌选择组件。这包括：

contents.text: - identifying the Brand List Component (see section 7.7) where the value of its ID attribute matches the BrandListRef attribute of the Payment Component. If no or more than one Brand List Component is found there is an error.
contents.zh-CHS: - 识别品牌列表组件（见第7.7节），其中其ID属性的值与支付组件的BrandListRef属性匹配。如果未发现或发现多个品牌列表组件，则存在错误。

contents.text: - identifying the Brand Selection Component (see section 7.8) where the value of its BrandListRef attribute matches the BrandListRef of the Payment Component. If no or more than one matching Brand Selection Component is found there is an error.
contents.zh-CHS: - 识别品牌选择组件（参见第7.8节），其中其BrandListRef属性的值与支付组件的BrandListRef匹配。如果未找到或找到多个匹配的品牌选择组件，则存在错误。

contents.text: o Identify the Brand, Protocol Amount, Pay Protocol and Currency Amount elements within the Brand List that have been selected by the Consumer as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: o 识别品牌列表中消费者已选择的品牌、协议金额、支付协议和货币金额元素，如下所示：

contents.text: - the Brand Element (see section 7.7.1) selected is the element where the value of its Id attribute matches the value of the BrandRef attribute in the Brand Selection. If no or more than one matching Brand Element is found then there is an error.
contents.zh-CHS: - 所选品牌元素（见第7.7.1节）是其Id属性值与品牌选择中BrandRef属性值匹配的元素。如果没有找到或找到多个匹配的品牌元素，则存在错误。

contents.text: - the Protocol Amount Element (see section 7.7.3) selected is the element where the value of its Id attribute matches the value of the ProtocolAmountRef attribute in the Brand Selection Component. If no or more than one matching Protocol Amount Element is found there is an error
contents.zh-CHS: - 选择的协议金额元素（见第7.7.3节）是其Id属性值与品牌选择组件中ProtocolAmountRef属性值匹配的元素。如果未找到或找到多个匹配的协议金额元素，则存在错误

contents.text: - the Pay Protocol Element (see section 7.7.5) selected is the element where the value of its Id attribute matches the value of the PayProtocolRef attribute in the identified Protocol Amount Element. If no or more than one matching Pay Protocol Element is found there is an error
contents.zh-CHS: - 选择的支付协议元素（见第7.7.5节）是其Id属性的值与已识别协议金额元素中PayProtocolRef属性的值匹配的元素。如果未找到或找到多个匹配的支付协议元素，则存在错误

contents.text: - the Currency Amount Element (see section 7.7.4) selected is the element where the value of its Id attribute matches the value of the CurrencyAmountRef attribute in the Brand Selection Component. If no or more than one matching Currency Amount element is found there is an error
contents.zh-CHS: - 选定的货币金额元素（见第7.7.4节）是其Id属性值与品牌选择组件中CurrencyAmountRef属性值匹配的元素。如果未找到或找到多个匹配的货币金额元素，则存在错误

contents.text: o Check the consistency of the references in the Brand List and Brand Selection Components:
contents.zh-CHS: o 检查品牌列表和品牌选择组件中参考的一致性：

contents.text: - check that an Element Reference exists in the ProtocolAmountRefs attribute of the identified Brand Element that matches the Id attribute of the identified Protocol Amount Element. If no or more than one matching Element Reference can be found there is an error
contents.zh-CHS: - 检查已标识品牌元素的ProtocolAmountRefs属性中是否存在与已标识协议金额元素的Id属性匹配的元素引用。如果找不到或超过一个匹配的元素引用，则存在错误

contents.text: - check that the CurrencyAmountRefs attribute of the identified Protocol Amount element contains an element reference that matches the Id attribute of the identified Currency Amount element. If no or more than one matching Element Reference is found there is an error.
contents.zh-CHS: - 检查标识的协议金额元素的CurrencyCamountRefs属性是否包含与标识的货币金额元素的Id属性匹配的元素引用。如果未找到或找到多个匹配元素引用，则存在错误。

contents.text: - check the consistency of the elements in the Brand List. Specifically, the selected Brand, Protocol Amount, Pay Protocol and Currency Amount Elements are all child elements of the identified Brand List Component. If they are not there is an error.
contents.zh-CHS: - 检查品牌列表中元素的一致性。具体而言，所选品牌、协议金额、支付协议和货币金额元素都是已识别品牌列表组件的子元素。如果没有，则会出现错误。

contents.text: o Check that the Payment Handler that received the Payment Request Block is the Payment Handler selected by the Consumer. This involves:
contents.zh-CHS: o 检查接收付款请求块的付款处理程序是否为消费者选择的付款处理程序。这包括：

contents.text: - identifying the Organisation Component for the Payment Handler. This is the Organisation Component where its ID attribute matches the ActionOrgRef attribute in the identified Pay Protocol Element. If no or more than one matching Organisation Component is found there is an error
contents.zh-CHS: - 确定支付处理人的组织组成部分。这是组织组件，其ID属性与已标识的支付协议元素中的ActionOrgRef属性匹配。如果未找到或找到多个匹配的组织组件，则存在错误

contents.text: - checking the Organisation Component has a Trading Role Element with a Role attribute of PaymentHandler. If not there is an error
contents.zh-CHS: - 检查组织组件是否具有角色属性为PaymentHandler的交易角色元素。如果没有，则会出现错误

contents.text: - finally, if the identified Organisation Component is not the same as the Organisation that received the Payment Request Block, then there is an error.
contents.zh-CHS: - 最后，如果识别的组织组件与接收付款请求块的组织不同，则存在错误。

contents.text: 6.3.1.2 Delivery
The way data is accessed by a Delivery Handler in order to check that it may carry out a delivery is illustrated in the figure below.
contents.zh-CHS: 交付处理程序访问数据以检查其是否可以执行交付的方式如下图所示。

contents.text:
*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*
                         Start
                           |
                           v
                        Delivery
                        Component
                           |
                           |ActionOrgRef
                           |
                           v
                        Organisation
                        Component
                        |
                         -Trading Role
                           Element
                        (Delivery Handler)
Figure 13 Checking a Delivery Handler can carry out a Delivery
contents.zh-CHS: 图13检查交付处理程序是否可以执行交付

contents.text: The steps involved are as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: 所涉及的步骤如下：

contents.text: o Identify the Delivery Component in the Delivery Request Block. If there is no or more than one matching Delivery Component there is an error
contents.zh-CHS: o 在传递请求块中标识传递组件。如果没有或多个匹配的传递组件，则存在错误

contents.text: o Use the ActionOrgRef attribute of the Delivery Component to identify the Organisation Component of the Delivery Handler. If there is no or more than one matching Organisation Component there is an error
contents.zh-CHS: o 使用交付组件的ActionOrgRef属性来标识交付处理程序的组织组件。如果没有或超过一个匹配的组织组件，则存在错误

contents.text: o If the Organisation Component for the Delivery Handler does not have a Trading Role Element with a Role attribute of DeliveryHandler there is an error
contents.zh-CHS: o 如果交付处理人的组织组件没有角色属性为DeliveryHandler的交易角色元素，则会发生错误

contents.text: o Finally, if the Organisation that received the Delivery Request Block does not identify the Organisation Component for the Delivery Handler as itself, then there is an error.
contents.zh-CHS: o 最后，如果接收传递请求块的组织未将传递处理程序的组织组件标识为自身，则存在错误。

contents.text: 6.3.2 Check Correct Components present in Request Block
contents.zh-CHS: 6.3.2 检查请求块中是否存在正确的组件

contents.text: Check that the correct components are present in the Payment Request Block (see section 8.7) or in the Delivery Request Block (see section 8.10).
contents.zh-CHS: 检查付款请求块（见第8.7节）或交货请求块（见第8.10节）中是否存在正确的组件。

contents.text: If components are missing, there is an error.
contents.zh-CHS: 如果缺少组件，则存在错误。

contents.text: 6.3.3 Check an Action is Authorised
contents.zh-CHS: 6.3.3 检查行动是否得到授权

contents.text: The previous steps identified the Action Organisation and that all the necessary components are present. This step checks that the Action Organisation is authorised to carry out the Action.
contents.zh-CHS: 前面的步骤确定了行动组织以及所有必要的组成部分。此步骤检查行动组织是否有权执行行动。

contents.text: In outline the Action Organisation will identifies the Merchant, checks that it has a pre-existing agreement with the Merchant that allows it carry out the Action and that any constraints implied by that agreement are being followed, then, if signatures are required, it checks that they sign the correct data.
contents.zh-CHS: 在概述中，行动组织将识别商户，检查其与商户之间是否存在允许其执行行动的协议，以及是否遵守该协议暗示的任何约束，然后，如果需要签名，则检查他们是否签署了正确的数据。

contents.text: The steps involved are as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: 所涉及的步骤如下：

contents.text: o Identify the Merchant. This is the Organisation Component with a Trading Role Element which has a Role attribute with a value of Merchant. If no or more than one Trading Role Element is found, there is an error
contents.zh-CHS: o 识别商户。这是具有交易角色元素的组织组件，其角色属性的值为Merchant。如果未找到或找到多个交易角色元素，则存在错误

contents.text: o Check the Action Organisation's agreements with the Merchant allows the Action to be carried out. To do this the Action Organisation must check that:
contents.zh-CHS: o 检查行动组织与商户之间的协议，以允许执行行动。为此，行动组织必须检查：

contents.text: - the Merchant is known and a pre-existing agreement exists for the Action Organisation to be their agent for the payment or delivery
contents.zh-CHS: - 商户是已知的，且存在一项预先存在的协议，行动组织将作为其支付或交付的代理人

contents.text: - they are allowed to take part in the type of IOTP transaction that is occurring. For example a Payment Handler may have agreed to accept payments as part of a Baseline Purchase, but not make payments as part of a Baseline Refund
contents.zh-CHS: - 允许他们参与正在发生的IOTP交易类型。例如，付款处理人可能已同意接受付款作为基线购买的一部分，但不将付款作为基线退款的一部分

contents.text: - any constraints in their agreement with the Merchant are being followed, for example, whether or not an Offer Response signature is required
contents.zh-CHS: - 遵守其与商户协议中的任何约束条件，例如，是否需要要约响应签名

contents.text: o Check the signatures are correct. If signatures are required then they need to be checked. This involves:
contents.zh-CHS: o 检查签名是否正确。如果需要签名，则需要检查签名。这包括：

contents.text: - Identifying the correct signatures to check. This involves the Action Organisation identifying the Signature Components that contain references to the Action Organisation (see 6.3.1). Depending on the IOTP Transaction being carried out (see section 9) either one or two signatures may be identified
contents.zh-CHS: - 确定要检查的正确签名。这涉及行动组织识别包含行动组织参考的签名组件（见6.3.1）。根据正在进行的IOTP交易（见第9节），可以识别一个或两个签名

contents.text: - checking that the Signature Components are correct. This involves checking that Digest elements exist within the Manifest Element that refer to the necessary Trading Components (see section 6.3.3.1).
contents.zh-CHS: - 检查签名组件是否正确。这涉及检查清单元素中是否存在引用必要交易组件的摘要元素（参见第6.3.3.1节）。

contents.text: 6.3.3.1 Check the Signatures Digests are correct
contents.zh-CHS: 6.3.3.1 检查签名摘要是否正确

contents.text: All Signature Components contained within IOTP Messages must include Digest elements that refer to:
contents.zh-CHS: IOTP消息中包含的所有签名组件必须包括涉及以下内容的摘要元素：

contents.text: o the Transaction Id Component (see section 3.3.1) of the IOTP message that contains the Signature Component. This binds the globally unique IotpTransId to other components which make up the IOTP Transaction
contents.zh-CHS: o 包含签名组件的IOTP消息的事务Id组件（见第3.3.1节）。这会将全局唯一的IotpTransId绑定到构成IOTP事务的其他组件

contents.text: o the Transaction Reference Block (see section 3.3) of the first IOTP Message that contained the signature. This binds the IotpTransId with information about the IOTP Message contained inside the Message Id Component (see section 3.3.2).
contents.zh-CHS: o 包含签名的第一条IOTP消息的事务参考块（见第3.3节）。这会将IotpTransId与包含在消息Id组件中的IOTP消息相关信息绑定（参见第3.3.2节）。

contents.text: Check that each Signature Component contains Digest elements that refer to the correct data required.
contents.zh-CHS: 检查每个签名组件是否包含引用所需正确数据的摘要元素。

contents.text: The Digest elements that need to be present depend on the Trading Role of the Organisation which generated (signed) the signature:
contents.zh-CHS: 需要呈现的摘要要素取决于生成（签署）签名的组织的交易角色：

contents.text: o if the signer of the signature is a Merchant then:
contents.zh-CHS: o 如果签名人是商户，则：

contents.text: - Digest elements must be present for all the components in the Request Block apart from the Brand Selection Component which is optional
contents.zh-CHS: - 除了可选的品牌选择组件外，请求块中的所有组件都必须具有摘要元素

contents.text: o if the signer of the signature is a Payment Handler then Digest elements must be present for:
contents.zh-CHS: o 如果签名的签名者是支付处理程序，则必须为以下内容提供摘要元素：

contents.text: - the Signature Component signed by the Merchant, and optionally
contents.zh-CHS: - 由商户签名的签名组件，以及可选的

contents.text: - one or more Signature Components signed by the previous Payment Handler(s) in the Transaction.
contents.zh-CHS: - 由交易中以前的支付处理程序签名的一个或多个签名组件。

contents.text: 7. Trading Components
contents.zh-CHS: 7. 贸易成分

contents.text: This section describes the Trading Components used within IOTP. Trading Components are the child XML elements which occur immediately below a Trading Block as illustrated in the diagram below.
contents.zh-CHS: 本节介绍IOTP中使用的交易组件。交易组件是发生在交易块正下方的子XML元素，如下图所示。

contents.text:
IOTP MESSAGE  <----------- IOTP Message - an XML Document
           |                         which is transported between the
           |                         Trading Roles
           |-Trans Ref Block <-----  Trans Ref Block - contains
           |  |                      information which describes the
           |  |                      IOTP Transaction and the IOTP
                                     Message.
 --------> |  |-Trans Id Comp. <---  Transaction Id Component -
|          |  |                      uniquely identifies the IOTP
|          |  |                      Transaction. The Trans Id
|          |  |                      Components are the same across
|          |  |                      all IOTP messages that comprise
|          |  |                      a single IOTP transaction.
|          |  |-Msg Id Comp. <-----  Message Id Component -
|          |                         identifies and describes an IOTP
|          |                         Message within an IOTP
|          |                         Transaction
|          |-Signature Block <-----  Signature Block (optional) -
|          |  |                      contains one or more Signature
|          |  |                      Components and their associated
|          |  |                      Certificates
|     ---> |  |-Signature Comp. <--  Signature Component - contains
|    |     |  |                      digital signatures. Signatures
|    |     |  |                      may sign digests of the Trans Ref
|    |     |  |                      Block and any Trading Component
|    |     |  |                      in any IOTP Message in the same
|    |     |  |                      IOTP Transaction.
|    |     |  |-Certificate Comp. <- Certificate Component. Used to
|    |     |                         check the signature.
  Trading  |-Trading Block <-------- Trading Block - an XML Element
Components |  |-Trading Comp.        within an IOTP Message that
|    |     |  |-Trading Comp.        contains a predefined set of
|     ---> |  |-Trading Comp.        Trading Components
|          |  |-Trading Comp.
|          |  |-Trading Comp. <----- Trading Components - XML
|          |                         Elements within a Trading Block
|          |-Trading Block           that contain a predefined set of
 --------> |  |-Trading Comp.        XML elements and attributes
           |  |-Trading Comp.        containing information required
           |  |-Trading Comp.        to support a Trading Exchange
           |  |-Trading Comp.
           |  |-Trading Comp.
*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*
Figure 14 Trading Components
contents.zh-CHS: 图14贸易组成部分

contents.text: The Trading Components described in this section are listed below in approximately the sequence they are likely to be used:
contents.zh-CHS: 本节所述的交易组成部分大致按照可能使用的顺序列示如下：

contents.text: o Protocol Options Component
contents.zh-CHS: o 协议选项组件

contents.text: o Authentication Request Component
contents.zh-CHS: o 身份验证请求组件

contents.text: o Authentication Response Component
contents.zh-CHS: o 身份验证响应组件

contents.text: o Trading Role Information Request Component
contents.zh-CHS: o 交易角色信息请求组件

contents.text: o Order Component
contents.zh-CHS: o 订单组件

contents.text: o Organisation Component
contents.zh-CHS: o 组织成分

contents.text: o Brand List Component
contents.zh-CHS: o 品牌列表组件

contents.text: o Brand Selection Component
contents.zh-CHS: o 品牌选择组件

contents.text: o Payment Component
contents.zh-CHS: o 支付部分

contents.text: o Payment Scheme Component
contents.zh-CHS: o 付款计划组成部分

contents.text: o Payment Receipt Component
contents.zh-CHS: o 付款收据组件

contents.text: o Delivery Component
contents.zh-CHS: o 交付组件

contents.text: o Delivery Data Component
contents.zh-CHS: o 交付数据组件

contents.text: o Delivery Note Component
contents.zh-CHS: o 交货通知单组件

contents.text: o Signature Component
contents.zh-CHS: o 签名组件

contents.text: o Certificate Component
contents.zh-CHS: o 证书组件

contents.text: o Error Component
contents.zh-CHS: o 误差分量

contents.text: Note that the following components are listed in other sections of this specification:
contents.zh-CHS: 请注意，本规范其他章节中列出了以下部件：

contents.text: o Transaction Id Component (see section 3.3.1)
contents.zh-CHS: o 事务Id组件（见第3.3.1节）

contents.text: o Message Id Component (see section 3.3.2)
contents.zh-CHS: o 消息Id组件（见第3.3.2节）

contents.text: 7.1 Protocol Options Component
contents.zh-CHS: 7.1 协议选项组件

contents.text: Protocol options are options which apply to the IOTP Transaction as a whole. Essentially it provides a short description of the entire transaction and the net location which the Consumer role should branch to if the IOTP Transaction is successful.
contents.zh-CHS: 协议选项是应用于整个IOTP事务的选项。本质上，它提供了整个交易的简短描述，以及如果IOTP交易成功，消费者角色应转移到的净位置。

contents.text: The definition of a Protocol Options Component is as follows.
contents.zh-CHS: 协议选项组件的定义如下所示。

contents.text:
<!ELEMENT ProtocolOptions EMPTY >
<!ATTLIST ProtocolOptions
 ID                 ID      #REQUIRED
 xml:lang           NMTOKEN #REQUIRED
 ShortDesc          CDATA   #REQUIRED
 SenderNetLocn      CDATA   #IMPLIED
 SecureSenderNetLocn CDATA  #IMPLIED
 SuccessNetLocn     CDATA   #REQUIRED >
Attributes:
contents.zh-CHS: 属性：

contents.text: ID An identifier which uniquely identifies the Protocol Options Component within the IOTP Transaction.
contents.zh-CHS: ID唯一标识IOTP事务中协议选项组件的标识符。

contents.text: Xml:lang Defines the language used by attributes or child elements within this component, unless overridden by an xml:lang attribute on a child element. See section 3.8 Identifying Languages.
contents.zh-CHS: Xml:lang定义此组件中的属性或子元素所使用的语言，除非被子元素上的Xml:lang属性覆盖。参见第3.8节识别语言。

contents.text: ShortDesc This contains a short description of the IOTP Transaction in the language defined by xml:lang. Its purpose is to provide an explanation of what type of IOTP Transaction is being conducted by the parties involved.
contents.zh-CHS: ShortDesc这包含以xml:lang定义的语言对IOTP交易的简短描述。其目的是解释相关方正在进行的IOTP交易类型。

contents.text: It is used to facilitate selecting an individual transaction from a list of similar transactions, for example from a database of IOTP transactions which has been stored by a Consumer, Merchant, etc.
contents.zh-CHS: 它用于帮助从类似交易列表中选择单个交易，例如从消费者、商户等存储的IOTP交易数据库中选择。

contents.text: SenderNetLocn This contains the non secured net location of the sender of the TPO Block in which the Protocol Options Component is contained.
contents.zh-CHS: SenderNetLocn包含TPO块的发送方的非安全网络位置，其中包含协议选项组件。

contents.text: It is the net location to which the recipient of the TPO block should send a TPO Selection Block if required.
contents.zh-CHS: 如果需要，TPO块的接收者应向其发送TPO选择块的净位置。

contents.text: The content of this attribute is dependent on the Transport Mechanism see the Transport Mechanism Supplement.
contents.zh-CHS: 此属性的内容取决于传输机制，请参见传输机制补充。

contents.text: SecureSenderNetLocn This contains the secured net location of the sender of the TPO Block in which the Protocol Options Component is contained.
contents.zh-CHS: SecureSenderNetLocn包含TPO块的发送方的安全网络位置，其中包含协议选项组件。

contents.text: The content of this attribute is dependent on the Transport Mechanism see the Transport Mechanism Supplement.
contents.zh-CHS: 此属性的内容取决于传输机制，请参见传输机制补充。

contents.text: SuccessNetLocn This contains the net location that should be displayed after the IOTP Transaction has successfully completed.
contents.zh-CHS: SuccessNetLocn包含IOTP事务成功完成后应显示的净位置。

contents.text: The content of this attribute is dependent on the Transport Mechanism see the Transport Mechanism Supplement.
contents.zh-CHS: 此属性的内容取决于传输机制，请参见传输机制补充。

contents.text: Either SenderNetLocn, SecureSenderNetLocn or both must be present.
contents.zh-CHS: SenderNetLocn、SecureSenderNetLocn或两者都必须存在。

contents.text: 7.2 Authentication Request Component
contents.zh-CHS: 7.2 身份验证请求组件

contents.text: This Trading Component contains parameter data that is used in an Authentication of one Trading Role by another. Its definition is as follows.
contents.zh-CHS: 此交易组件包含用于一个交易角色对另一个交易角色进行身份验证的参数数据。其定义如下。

contents.text:
<!ELEMENT AuthReq (Algorithm, PackagedContent*)>
<!ATTLIST AuthReq
 ID                 ID      #REQUIRED
 AuthenticationId   CDATA   #REQUIRED
 ContentSoftwareId  CDATA   #IMPLIED >

If required the Algorithm may use the challenge data, contained in the Packaged Content elements within the Authentication Request Component in its calculation. The format of the Packaged Contents are Algorithm dependent.
contents.zh-CHS: 如果需要，该算法可以在其计算中使用包含在认证请求组件内的打包内容元素中的质询数据。打包内容的格式取决于算法。

contents.text: Attributes:
contents.zh-CHS: 属性：

contents.text: ID An identifier which uniquely identifies the Authentication Request Component within the IOTP Transaction.
contents.zh-CHS: ID唯一标识IOTP事务中身份验证请求组件的标识符。

contents.text: AuthenticationId An identifier specified by the Authenticator which, if returned by the Organisation that receives the Authentication Request, will enable
contents.zh-CHS: AuthenticationId由认证者指定的标识符，如果接收认证请求的组织返回该标识符，则将启用该标识符

contents.text: the Authenticator to identify which Authentication is being referred to.
contents.zh-CHS: 用于标识所引用的身份验证的身份验证程序。

contents.text: ContentSoftwareId See section 14.Glossary
contents.zh-CHS: ContentSoftwareId见第14节术语表

contents.text: Content:
contents.zh-CHS: 内容：

contents.text: PackagedContent This contains the challenge data as one or more Packaged Content (see section 3.7) that is to be responded to using the Algorithm defined by the Algorithm element.
contents.zh-CHS: PackagedContent包含质询数据作为一个或多个打包内容（参见第3.7节），将使用算法元素定义的算法对其进行响应。

contents.text: Algorithm This contains information which describes the Algorithm (see 7.19 Signature Components) that must be used to generate the Authentication Response.
contents.zh-CHS: 算法包含描述生成认证响应必须使用的算法（见7.19签名组件）的信息。

contents.text: The Algorithms that may be used are identified by the Name attribute of the Algorithm element. For valid values see section 12. IANA Considerations.
contents.zh-CHS: 可以使用的算法由算法元素的Name属性标识。有关有效值，请参见第12节。IANA考虑因素。

contents.text: 7.3 Authentication Response Component
contents.zh-CHS: 7.3 身份验证响应组件

contents.text: The Authentication Response Component contains the results of an authentication request. It uses the Algorithm contained in the Authentication Request Component (see section 7.2) selected from the Authentication Request Block (see section 8.4).
contents.zh-CHS: 身份验证响应组件包含身份验证请求的结果。它使用从认证请求块（参见第8.4节）中选择的认证请求组件（参见第7.2节）中包含的算法。

contents.text: Depending on the Algorithm selected, the results of applying the algorithm will either be contained in a Signature Component that signs both the Authentication Response and potentially other data, or in the Packaged Content elements within the Authentication Response Component. Its definition is as follows.
contents.zh-CHS: 根据选择的算法，应用该算法的结果将包含在对认证响应和可能的其他数据进行签名的签名组件中，或者包含在认证响应组件内的打包内容元素中。其定义如下。

contents.text:
<!ELEMENT AuthResp (PackagedContent*) >
<!ATTLIST AuthResp
 ID                 ID      #REQUIRED
 AuthenticationId   CDATA   #REQUIRED
 SelectedAlgorithmRef NMTOKEN #REQUIRED
 ContentSoftwareId  CDATA   #IMPLIED >
Attributes:
contents.zh-CHS: 属性：

contents.text: ID An identifier which uniquely identifies the Authentication Response Component within the IOTP Transaction.
contents.zh-CHS: ID唯一标识IOTP事务中身份验证响应组件的标识符。

contents.text: AuthenticationId The Authentication identifier specified by the Authenticator that was included in the Authentication Request Component(see section 7.2). This will enable the Authenticator to identify the Authentication that is being referred to.
contents.zh-CHS: AuthenticationId由身份验证请求组件中包含的身份验证程序指定的身份验证标识符（参见第7.2节）。这将使身份验证程序能够识别所引用的身份验证。

contents.text: SelectedAlgorithmRef An Element Reference that identifies the Algorithm element used to generate the Authentication Response.
contents.zh-CHS: SelectedAlgorithmRef元素引用，用于标识用于生成身份验证响应的算法元素。

contents.text: ContentSoftwareId See section 14.Glossary.
contents.zh-CHS: ContentSoftwareId请参见第14.1节术语表。

contents.text: Content:
contents.zh-CHS: 内容：

contents.text: PackagedContent This may contain the response generated as a result of applying the Algorithm selected from the Authentication Request Component see section 7.2.
contents.zh-CHS: PackagedContent这可能包含由于应用从身份验证请求组件中选择的算法而生成的响应，请参见第7.2节。

contents.text: For example, for a payment specific scheme, it may contain scheme-specific data. Refer to the scheme-specific supplemental documentation for definitions of its content.
contents.zh-CHS: 例如，对于特定于支付的方案，它可能包含特定于方案的数据。有关其内容的定义，请参阅特定于方案的补充文档。

contents.text: 7.4 Trading Role Information Request Component
contents.zh-CHS: 7.4 交易角色信息请求组件

contents.text: This Trading Component contains a list of Trading Roles (see section 2.1) about which information is being requested. The result of a Trading Role Request is a set of Organisation Components (see section 7.6) that describe each of the Trading Roles requested.
contents.zh-CHS: 此交易组件包含一个交易角色列表（参见第2.1节），其中包含所请求的信息。交易角色请求的结果是一组描述所请求的每个交易角色的组织组件（见第7.6节）。

contents.text: Example usage includes:
contents.zh-CHS: 示例用法包括：

contents.text: o a Merchant requesting that a Consumer provides Organisation Components for the Consumer and DelivTo Trading Roles
contents.zh-CHS: o 要求消费者为消费者提供组织组件并交付给交易角色的商户

contents.text: o a Consumer requesting from a Merchant, information about the Payment Handlers and Delivery Handlers that the Merchant uses.
contents.zh-CHS: o 消费者向商户请求有关商户使用的支付处理程序和交付处理程序的信息。

contents.text: Its definition is as follows.
contents.zh-CHS: 其定义如下。

contents.text:
<!ELEMENT TradingRoleInfoReq EMPTY>
<!ATTLIST TradingRoleInfoReq
 ID                 ID      #REQUIRED
 TradingRoleList    NMTOKENS #REQUIRED >
Attributes:
contents.zh-CHS: 属性：

contents.text: ID An identifier which uniquely identifies the Trading Role Information Request Component within the IOTP Transaction.
contents.zh-CHS: ID唯一标识IOTP交易中交易角色信息请求组件的标识符。

contents.text: TradingRoleList Contains a list of one or more Trading Roles (see the TradingRole attribute of the Trading Role Element - section 7.6.2) for which information is being requested.
contents.zh-CHS: TradingRoleList包含一个或多个交易角色的列表（请参见交易角色元素的TradingRole属性-第7.6.2节），请求获取这些角色的信息。

contents.text: 7.5 Order Component
contents.zh-CHS: 7.5 订单组件

contents.text: An Order Component contains information about an order. Its definition is as follows.
contents.zh-CHS: 订单组件包含有关订单的信息。其定义如下。

contents.text:
<!ELEMENT Order (PackagedContent*) >
<!ATTLIST Order
 ID                 ID      #REQUIRED
 xml:lang           NMTOKEN #REQUIRED
 OrderIdentifier    CDATA   #REQUIRED
 ShortDesc          CDATA   #REQUIRED
 OkFrom             CDATA   #REQUIRED
 OkTo               CDATA   #REQUIRED
 ApplicableLaw      CDATA   #REQUIRED
 ContentSoftwareId  CDATA   #IMPLIED >
Attributes:
contents.zh-CHS: 属性：

contents.text: ID An identifier which uniquely identifies the Order Component within the IOTP Transaction.
contents.zh-CHS: ID唯一标识IOTP事务中订单组件的标识符。

contents.text: xml:lang Defines the language used by attributes or child elements within this component, unless overridden by an xml:lang attribute on a child element. See section 3.8 Identifying Languages.
contents.zh-CHS: xml:lang定义此组件中的属性或子元素所使用的语言，除非被子元素上的xml:lang属性覆盖。参见第3.8节识别语言。

contents.text: OrderIdentifier This is a code, reference number or other identifier which the creator of the Order may use to identify the order. It must be unique within an IOTP Transaction. If it is used in this way, then it may remove the need to specify any content for the Order element as the reference can be used to look up the necessary information in a database.
contents.zh-CHS: OrderIdentifier这是订单创建者可用于标识订单的代码、参考号或其他标识符。它在IOTP事务中必须是唯一的。如果以这种方式使用，那么就不需要为Order元素指定任何内容，因为引用可用于在数据库中查找必要的信息。

contents.text: ShortDesc A short description of the order in the language defined by xml:lang. It is used to facilitate selecting an individual order from a list of
contents.zh-CHS: ShortDesc用xml:lang定义的语言对订单进行简短描述。它用于帮助从订单列表中选择单个订单

contents.text: orders, for example from a database of orders which has been stored by a Consumer, Merchant, etc.
contents.zh-CHS: 订单，例如来自消费者、商户等存储的订单数据库。

contents.text: OkFrom The date and time in [UTC] format after which the offer made by the Merchant lapses.
contents.zh-CHS: Ok从[UTC]格式的日期和时间开始，在此日期和时间之后，商户的报价失效。

contents.text: OkTo The date and time in [UTC] format before which a Value Acquirer may accept the offer made by the Merchant is not valid.
contents.zh-CHS: Ok以[UTC]格式表示的日期和时间无效，在此之前，价值收单机构可以接受商户的报价。

contents.text: ApplicableLaw A phrase in the language defined by xml:lang which describes the state or country of jurisdiction which will apply in resolving problems or disputes.
contents.zh-CHS: 适用法律xml:lang定义的语言中的一个短语，描述将应用于解决问题或争端的管辖州或国家。

contents.text: ContentSoftwareId See section 14.Glossary.
contents.zh-CHS: ContentSoftwareId请参见第14.1节术语表。

contents.text: Content:
contents.zh-CHS: 内容：

contents.text: PackagedContent An optional description of the order information as one or more Packaged Contents (see section 3.7).
contents.zh-CHS: PackagedContent作为一个或多个打包内容对订单信息的可选描述（参见第3.7节）。

contents.text: 7.5.1 Order Description Content
contents.zh-CHS: 7.5.1 订单描述内容

contents.text: The Packaged Content element will normally be required, however it may be omitted where sufficient information about the purchase can be provided in the ShortDesc attribute. If the full Order Description requires it several Packaged Content elements may be used.
contents.zh-CHS: 打包内容元素通常是必需的，但是如果可以在ShortDesc属性中提供有关购买的足够信息，则可以省略它。如果完整订单描述需要，可以使用多个打包内容元素。

contents.text: Although the amount and currency are likely to appear in the Packaged Content of the Order Description it is the amount and currency contained in the payment related trading components (Brand List, Brand Selection and Payment) that is authoritative. This means it is important that the amount actually being paid (as contained in the payment related trading components) is prominently displayed to the Consumer.
contents.zh-CHS: 虽然金额和货币可能出现在订单说明的包装内容中，但与支付相关的交易组件（品牌列表、品牌选择和支付）中包含的金额和货币才是权威的。这意味着向消费者突出显示实际支付的金额（包含在支付相关的交易组件中）非常重要。

contents.text: For interoperability, implementations must support Plain Text, HTML and XML as a minimum so that it can be easily displayed.
contents.zh-CHS: 为了实现互操作性，实现必须至少支持纯文本、HTML和XML，以便能够轻松显示。

contents.text: 7.5.2 OkFrom and OkTo Timestamps
contents.zh-CHS: 7.5.2 OkFrom和OkTo时间戳

contents.text: Note that:
contents.zh-CHS: 请注意：

contents.text: o the OkFrom date may be later than the OkFrom date on the Payment Component (see section 7.9) associated with this order, and
contents.zh-CHS: o 与本订单相关的付款组件（见第7.9节）上的确认起始日期可能晚于确认起始日期，以及

contents.text: o similarly, the OkTo date may be earlier that the OkTo date on the Payment Component (see section 7.9).
contents.zh-CHS: o 类似地，付款部分的截止日期可能早于截止日期（见第7.9节）。

contents.text: Note: Disclaimer. The following information provided in this note does not represent formal advice of any of the authors of this specification. Readers of this specification must form their own views and seek their own legal counsel on the usefulness and applicability of this information.
contents.zh-CHS: 注：免责声明。本说明中提供的以下信息不代表本规范任何作者的正式建议。本规范的读者必须形成自己的观点，并就本信息的有用性和适用性寻求自己的法律顾问。

contents.text: The merchant in the context of Internet commerce with anonymous consumers initially frames the terms of the offer on the web page, and in order to obtain the goods or services, the consumer must accept them.
contents.zh-CHS: 在与匿名消费者进行互联网商务的情况下，商家最初在网页上制定要约的条款，为了获得商品或服务，消费者必须接受这些条款。

contents.text: If there is to be a time-limited offer, it is recommended that merchants communicate this to the consumer and state in the order description in a manner which is clear to the consumer that:
contents.zh-CHS: 如果有限时优惠，建议商家将此告知消费者，并在订单描述中以消费者清楚的方式说明：

contents.text: o the offer is time limited
contents.zh-CHS: o 报价有时间限制

contents.text: o the OkFrom and OkTo timestamps specify the validity of the offer
contents.zh-CHS: o OkFrom和OkTo时间戳指定报价的有效性

contents.text: o the clock, e.g., the merchant's clock, that will be used to determine the validity of the offer
contents.zh-CHS: o 用于确定报价有效性的时钟，例如商户的时钟

contents.text: Also note that although the OkFrom and OkTo dates are likely to appear in the Packaged Content of the Order Description it is the dates contained in the Order Component that is authoritative. This means it is important that the OkFrom and OkTo dates actually being used is prominently displayed to the Consumer.
contents.zh-CHS: 还要注意的是，尽管订单描述的打包内容中可能会出现OkFrom和OkTo日期，但具有权威性的是订单组件中包含的日期。这意味着向消费者突出显示实际使用的OkFrom和OkTo日期非常重要。

contents.text: 7.6 Organisation Component
contents.zh-CHS: 7.6 组织成分

contents.text: The Organisation Component provides information about an individual or an Organisation. This can be used for a variety of purposes. For example:
contents.zh-CHS: “组织”组件提供有关个人或组织的信息。这可以用于多种目的。例如：

contents.text: o to describe the merchant who is selling the goods,
contents.zh-CHS: o 描述销售商品的商人，

contents.text: o to identify who made a purchase,
contents.zh-CHS: o 要确定谁进行了购买，

contents.text: o to identify who will take delivery of goods,
contents.zh-CHS: o 确定谁将提货，

contents.text: o to provide a customer care contact,
contents.zh-CHS: o 提供客户服务联系人，

contents.text: o to describe who will be the Payment Handler.
contents.zh-CHS: o 描述谁将成为付款处理人。

contents.text: Note that the Organisation Components which must be present in an IOTP Message are dependent on the particular transaction being carried out. Refer to section 9. Internet Open Trading Protocol Transactions, for more details.
contents.zh-CHS: 请注意，IOTP消息中必须存在的组织组件取决于正在执行的特定交易。参见第9节。互联网开放交易协议交易，了解更多详情。

contents.text: Its definition is as follows.
contents.zh-CHS: 其定义如下。

contents.text:
<!ELEMENT Org (TradingRole+, ContactInfo?,
     PersonName?, PostalAddress?)>
<!ATTLIST Org
 ID                 ID      #REQUIRED
 xml:lang           NMTOKEN #REQUIRED
 OrgId              CDATA   #REQUIRED
 LegalName          CDATA   #IMPLIED
 ShortDesc          CDATA   #IMPLIED
 LogoNetLocn        CDATA   #IMPLIED >
Attributes:
contents.zh-CHS: 属性：

contents.text: ID An identifier which uniquely identifies the Organisation Component within the IOTP Transaction.
contents.zh-CHS: ID唯一标识IOTP交易中组织组成部分的标识符。

contents.text: xml:lang Defines the language used by attributes or child elements within this component, unless overridden by an xml:lang attribute on a child element. See section 3.8 Identifying Languages.
contents.zh-CHS: xml:lang定义此组件中的属性或子元素所使用的语言，除非被子元素上的xml:lang属性覆盖。参见第3.8节识别语言。

contents.text: OrgId A code which identifies the Organisation described by the Organisation Component. See 7.6.1 Organisation IDs, below.
contents.zh-CHS: OrgId标识组织组成部分描述的组织的代码。见下文7.6.1组织ID。

contents.text: LegalName For Organisations which are companies this is their legal name in the language defined by xml:lang. It is required for Organisations who have a Trading Role other than Consumer or DelivTo.
contents.zh-CHS: LegalName适用于公司组织这是他们的法定名称，使用xml:lang定义的语言。对于具有除消费者或送货人以外的贸易角色的组织，这是必需的。

contents.text: ShortDesc A short description of the Organisation in the language defined by xml:lang. It is typically the name by which the Organisation is commonly known. For example, if the legal name was "Blue Meadows Financial Services Inc.". Then its short name would likely be "Blue Meadows".
contents.zh-CHS: ShortDesc用xml:lang定义的语言对组织进行简短描述。它通常是组织的常用名称。例如，如果法定名称为“Blue Meadows Financial Services Inc.”。那么它的简称可能是“蓝色草地”。

contents.text: It is used to facilitate selecting an individual Organisation from a list of Organisations, for example from a database of Organisations involved
contents.zh-CHS: 它用于帮助从组织列表中选择单个组织，例如从相关组织的数据库中选择

contents.text: in IOTP Transactions which has been stored by a consumer.
contents.zh-CHS: 在IOTP事务中，消费者已存储该事务。

contents.text: LogoNetLocn The net location which can be used to download the logo for the Organisation.
contents.zh-CHS: LogoNetLocn可用于下载组织徽标的网络位置。

contents.text: See section 10 Retrieving Logos.
contents.zh-CHS: 参见第10节检索徽标。

contents.text: The content of this attribute must conform to [RFC1738].
contents.zh-CHS: 此属性的内容必须符合[RFC1738]。

contents.text: Content:
contents.zh-CHS: 内容：

contents.text: TradingRole See 7.6.2 Trading Role Element below.
contents.zh-CHS: 交易角色见下文7.6.2交易角色要素。

contents.text: ContactInfo See 7.6.3 Contact Information Element below.
contents.zh-CHS: 联系信息见下面的7.6.3联系信息元素。

contents.text: PersonName See 7.6.4 Person Name below.
contents.zh-CHS: 人名见下面的7.6.4人名。

contents.text: PostalAddress See 7.6.5 Postal Address below.
contents.zh-CHS: 邮寄地址见下面7.6.5的邮寄地址。

contents.text: 7.6.1 Organisation IDs
contents.zh-CHS: 7.6.1 组织ID

contents.text: Organisation IDs are used by one IOTP Trading Role to identify another. In order to avoid confusion, this means that these IDs must be globally unique.
contents.zh-CHS: 一个IOTP交易角色使用组织ID识别另一个。为了避免混淆，这意味着这些ID必须是全局唯一的。

contents.text: In principle this is achieved in the following way:
contents.zh-CHS: 原则上，这是通过以下方式实现的：

contents.text: o the Organisation Id for all trading roles, apart from the Consumer Trading Role, uses a domain name as their globally unique identifier,
contents.zh-CHS: o 除消费者交易角色外，所有交易角色的组织Id均使用域名作为其全球唯一标识符，

contents.text: o the Organisation Id for a Consumer Trading Role is allocated by one of the other Trading Roles in an IOTP Transaction and is made unique by concatenating it with that other roles' Organisation Id,
contents.zh-CHS: o 消费者交易角色的组织Id由IOTP交易中的一个其他交易角色分配，并通过将其与该其他角色的组织Id连接而变得唯一，

contents.text: o once a Consumer is allocated an Organisation Id within an IOTP Transaction the same Organisation Id is used by all the other trading roles in that IOTP transaction to identify that Consumer.
contents.zh-CHS: o 一旦在IOTP交易中为消费者分配了组织Id，该IOTP交易中的所有其他交易角色将使用相同的组织Id来识别该消费者。

contents.text: Specifically, the content of the Organisation ID is defined as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: 具体而言，组织ID的内容定义如下：

contents.text:
OrgId ::= NonConsumerOrgId | ConsumerOrgId
NonConsumerOrgId ::= DomainName
ConsumerOrgId ::= ConsumerOrgIdPrefix (namechar)+ "/" NonConsumerOrgId
ConsumerOrgIdPrefix ::= "Consumer:"
ConsumerOrgId The Organisation ID for a Consumer consists of: o a standard prefix to identify that the Organisation Id is for a consumer, followed by
contents.zh-CHS: consumerrorgid消费者的组织ID包括：o用于标识组织ID是消费者的标准前缀，后跟

contents.text: o one or more characters which conform to the definition of an XML "namechar". See [XML] specifications, followed by o the NonConsumerOrgId for the Organisation which allocated the ConsumerOrgId. It is normally the Merchant role.
contents.zh-CHS: o 符合XML“namechar”定义的一个或多个字符。参见[XML]规范，然后是分配消费者GID的组织的非消费者。这通常是商家的角色。

contents.text: Use of upper and lower case is not significant.
contents.zh-CHS: 大写和小写的使用并不重要。

contents.text: NonConsumerOrgId If the Role is not Consumer then this contains the Canonical Name for the non-consumer Organisation being described by the Organisation Component. See [DNS] optionally followed by additional characters, if required, to make the NonConsumerOrgId unique.
contents.zh-CHS: 非消费者如果角色不是消费者，则该角色包含由组织组件描述的非消费者组织的规范名称。请参阅[DNS]，如果需要，可选择后跟其他字符，以使非消费者权限唯一。

contents.text: Note that a NonConsumerOrgId may not start with the ConsumerOrgIdPrefix.
contents.zh-CHS: 请注意，非consumerorgid不能以consumerorgid前缀开头。

contents.text: Use of upper and lower case is not significant.
contents.zh-CHS: 大写和小写的使用并不重要。

contents.text: Examples of Organisation Ids follow:
contents.zh-CHS: 组织ID的示例如下：

contents.text: o newjerseybooks.com - a merchant Organisation id
contents.zh-CHS: o newjerseybooks.com-商户组织id

contents.text: o westernbank.co.uk - a Payment Handler Organisation id
contents.zh-CHS: o westernbank.co.uk-支付处理机构id

contents.text: o consumer:1000247ABH/newjerseybooks.com - a consumer Organisation id allocated by a merchant
contents.zh-CHS: o 消费者：1000247ABH/newjerseybooks.com-商户分配的消费者组织id

contents.text: 7.6.2 Trading Role Element
contents.zh-CHS: 7.6.2 贸易角色要素

contents.text: This identifies the Trading Role of an individual or Organisation in the IOTP Transaction. Note, an Organisation may have more than one Trading Role and several roles may be present in one Organisation element. Its definition is as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: 这确定了个人或组织在IOTP交易中的交易角色。注意，一个组织可能有多个交易角色，并且一个组织元素中可能存在多个角色。其定义如下：

contents.text:
<!ELEMENT TradingRole EMPTY >
<!ATTLIST TradingRole
 ID                 ID      #REQUIRED
 TradingRole        NMTOKEN #REQUIRED
 IotpMsgIdPrefix    NMTOKEN #REQUIRED
 CancelNetLocn      CDATA   #IMPLIED
 ErrorNetLocn       CDATA   #IMPLIED
ErrorLogNetLocn CDATA #IMPLIED >
contents.zh-CHS: ErrorLogNetLocn CDATA#隐含>

contents.text: Attributes:
contents.zh-CHS: 属性：

contents.text: ID An identifier which uniquely identifies the Trading Role Element within the IOTP Transaction.
contents.zh-CHS: ID唯一标识IOTP交易中交易角色元素的标识符。

contents.text:
TradingRole        The trading role of the Organisation. Valid values
                   are:
                    o Consumer. The person or Organisation that is
                      acting in the role of a consumer in the IOTP
                      Transaction.
                    o Merchant. The person or Organisation that is
                      acting in the role of merchant in the IOTP
                      Transaction.
                    o PaymentHandler. The financial institution or
